titles.title: To designate the Federal building located at 600 Martin Luther King, Jr. Place in Louisville, Kentucky, as the "Romano L. Mazzoli Federal Building".

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Economic Development.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 104-366.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 138.

action.text: Mr. Gilchrest moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 5, rule I, the chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 415 - 0 (Roll no. 835).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

calendar.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Environment and Public Works

action.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported to Senate by Senator Chafee without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 289.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 2/15/1995--Introduced. Designates the Federal building located at 600 Martin Luther King, Jr. Place in Louisville, Kentucky, as the Romano L. Mazzoli Federal Building.
